byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and AMY CHOZICK

abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton takes control of Democratic primary contests as she defeats Bernie Sanders in several states, proving her ability to build diverse coalition of voters; Clinton's success is attributed to her skill in capturing minority votes in key areas and in drawing on deep Southern Democratic roots.
lead_paragraph: Based on initial results from the primaries and caucuses across 11 states, Mrs. Clinton was strongly positioned to contain Bernie Sanders to liberal strongholds like his home state, Vermont.

headline.main: Minority Voters Push Hillary Clinton to Victories
headline.print_headline: Minority Voters Help Push Clinton to Triumphs in Democratic Race

snippet: Based on initial results from the primaries and caucuses across 11 states, Mrs. Clinton was strongly positioned to contain Bernie Sanders to liberal strongholds like his home state, Vermont.
